<<<api>>>: PrintWriter.write
<<<code>>>: try { printWriter.write("1\n"); } catch (Exception e) { e.printStackTrace(); }
<<<explanation>>>: The problem is that you are writing string without a line break. But BufferedReader expects one of the line characters mentioned above which you are not providing. It does output the whole buffer once the end of the stream is reached though. To fix this, you need to add a line break character at the end of the string you are writing.
